content: sock copyright © general hogbuffer 2024 whether this is your first attempt ever to knit a pair of socks or whether you have tried before but want to get the basics right this pattern is for you let s try and answer all the questions and give you all the information necessary for success this is a top-down sock with a heel flap & gusset construction while there are various other options of construction and almost innumerable alternatives for all the different elements in the anatomy of a basic sock i believe that this is the best place to start without delving too far into the history of knitting i think there is a reason why this particular shape and construction method has prevailed and emerged as the standard classic sock because it just works it will be virtually impossible to find a foot that this sock will not fit as the options for customisation are so plentiful and i firmly believe that one should master the classics before tackling the alternatives yarn choice on socks as on many other items the finer the yarn the finer the gauge and the more luxurious the finished result there is a clear tipping point though at which this not only becomes impractical for the home knitter to attempt it will also result in a garment that is incredibly fragile and will require special care and attention if at any time in your life you feel the urge to produce a stocking made from single ply gossamer weight silk worked on 1mm needles please go ahead you will earn my eternal admiration if you persevere but for the purposes of learning to knit socks we will start with a standard 4 ply sock yarn needles if you work with 5 double pointed needles dpns 2 circular needles a single long circular needle and magic loop or one of the 9-inch circular sock needles is a matter of preference and personal convenience for the purpose of the instructions i will assume you are working on two needles ei- ther separate circulars or magic loop if you prefer dpns when i mention needle 1 it will mean your dpneedles 1 and 2 when i say needle 2 it will mean your dpneedles 3 and 4 if you work on a single circular sock needle you will need to place 2 stitch markers one for the beginning of the round i e the start of needle 1 and one at the half-way mark i e the start of needle 2 gauge for a 4 ply sock yarn the default needle size to start with is 2 5 mm keeping in mind that you may have to go up or down a needle size to achieve the desired fabric socks tend to be worked with a gauge of around 8 stitches per inch 32 sts per 10 cms but there is a certain
